data.text:
@JohnPasalis I wonder if you'd recapped what happened to rents in the same period if you'd have gotten the same results.

To me looking at housing prices in isolation from rents doesn't make sense. What happened in rents over the same period sheds light on the real drivers.

@PHfloor @JohnPasalis @LauderAdam Those rate cuts and holding it there for two years (till 2017) had something to do with the run-up in houses prices (TO &Van) plus foreign capital. In Alberta, home prices didn't crash, prices stagnated.

@PHfloor @JohnPasalis @LauderAdam Bank of Cdn cut rates twice in 2015(Jan. & July) in response to the oil crash in 2014. Massive layoffs and exodus in Alberta. 
https://t.co/R9WSi1J8VA

@JohnPasalis Combination of an increase from RE investors because of an increase in permanent residents and temporary residents (students), foreign capital flight from their home countries  and money laundering.

@adtrace @JusticeQueen6 @JohnPasalis We did a great interview with @ronmortgageguy who said he was seeing a rise in homeowners leveraging their existing home when upgrading, and keeping their existing property.

https://t.co/WomGTa8ivj
@JohnPasalis Would be nice to compare against immigration numbers.

@jofx @MikePMoffatt @JohnPasalis by "inter generational wealth transfer" you mean borrowing against your house to buy another house, you should rename it "intergenerational risk sharing" it's paper wealth.
@JohnPasalis basically, you show me incentives I'll show you I'll show you an outcome.
